Nicely done... that said you definitely did it the hard way using those shuttles.  I did this years ago long before the reddit challenge.  I was trying to use the asteroids to make a sort of fuel base.  I got 2 of the biggest asteroids thinking that their incredible mass would make a base for my station that would be more stable than the flimsy constructs KSP allowed at the time.  In the end it didn't work as the whole thing was apparently made of explodium but docking the together was easy once I got them anywhere near each other.  Long story short if you can imagine I had a claw, then probe body, then rcs fuel with 4 rcs on it, then docking port.  I had another one of these elsewhere on my ship.  Once I had the asteroids near each other I detached the docking port from the first claw from the front of my ship and backed the ship off.  Then I detached the docking port on the second claw and used the rcs to fly it over and dock it with the first claw.  So now I had two claws on one asteroid with one attacked and the other facing outward.  Also 2 rcs tanks, and 8 rcs.  From there it was incredibly simple to use the rcs to fly that asteroid towards the other.  Once the claw touched it was a done deal.  Basically what you did only without the shuttles in the middle.  I know this is an old video, but just a thought in case you ever do it again.

I did something similar to this once, I was playing dark multiplayer with my friend and I wanted to get a refueling base in Kerbin orbit. I built an absolutely massive rocket with the intent of getting a large asteroid into the orbit. My friend later built a space station he wanted to put in orbit around duna, but it was 160 tons and hard to divide into pieces. I pulled the asteroid pusher back into service and strapped the entire station on top and got there with plenty of fuel to spare xD.
The mating ritual of the space shuttle truly is a wonderful display of the beauty of nature.
Right-mouse + space is superior EVA controls. You look around with the mouse, and WASD+shift/ctrl to move around.
